page.title: 01Farming
page.content: We went to Shipton Oliffe to talk to a farmer called Mr Bailey-Hamilton. He farms 1035 acres land and owns both North and South Farms. There used to be 12 people working on the farm,but now there are only five. He has two combines,eight tractors, one fork-lift truck and trailers and hay-making equipment. He grows 60 acres of peas,340 acres of winter barley, 280 winter wheat,200 acres of spring wheat and there are 85 acres of woodland. The woodland is there because it looks nice and is good for the game. He told us that 1982 was his best year for crops and 1976 was the worst because of the drought.
